results.title: Home
results.creator_credit: Zephlyn Neilsen, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Zephlyn Neilsen reflects on the meaning of home through her recollections of growing up in rural Victoria. This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with Arts Victoria and the Community Support Fund.

results.title: Wild life in bushland
results.creator_credit: Victorian Government Tourist Bureau and Victorian Railways
results.brief_description: A study of the Healesville Sanctuary for Australian native animals and birds that was originally established by Sir Colin Mackenzie in 1921 to protect injured and endangered native animals in a natural bush environment. Almost 50 Australian animals are captured on film including platypus, lyrebirds and a fighting kangaroo. Commentary: Ray Chapman. Photographed and edited by A. M. Fairfoul. Produced with the collaboration of the sanctuary’s director, David H. Fleay.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Victorian Government Tourist Bureau and Victorian Railways

results.title: Harvey
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Rachel Roberts, Priscilla Collins and Peter McDonald
results.brief_description: A dark tale of obsession and loneliness about a man searching for physical and emotional completeness. It is only when he thinks he has achieved this goal through the unwilling coalescence of his neighbour that he begins to understand the painful, irresolvable nature of his obsession. Stars Nicholas Hope as Harvey and Lisa Angove as Lily.

results.title: Egg
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Anne Gilhooly and Nicole Mitchell
results.brief_description:
An elderly woman living alone in her suburban family home makes a friend - a fallen bird’s egg she finds in the local park. She takes Egg into her home, and into her heart.
A sensual and evocative film about lonliness, life and love.
Features Paulette Perry as the woman.

results.title: That's showbiz
results.brief_description: A hilarious comedy which details the rise and fall of a failing outback vaudeville troupe which imports an infamous city striptease, Madame Lash, to enliven their act.

results.title: A Colour Box
results.brief_description: The purely abstract A Colour Box” was Len Lye’s first experiment with painting in colour directly onto celluloid. After its initial release in 1935, John Grierson acquired the film for the United Kingdom General Post Office, and it was re-released in 1937 as an advertisement.

constellations_other.name: Circling expanded cinema
constellations_other.description: Explore how expanded cinema like Lis Rhodes' Light Music connects to film composers, experimental materials and virtual reality.

results.description: The purely abstract “A Colour Box” was Len Lye’s first experiment with painting in colour directly onto celluloid. After its initial release in 1935, John Grierson acquired the film for the United Kingdom General Post Office, and it was re-released in 1937 as an advertisement, with the addition of a “cheaper parcel post” message. Note: this film has been restored by the National Film and Television Archive (UK) from Lye’s original material using the Eastmancolor process.
description_for_label: The purely abstract “A Colour Box” was Len Lye’s first experiment with painting in colour directly onto celluloid. After its initial release in 1935, John Grierson acquired the film for the United Kingdom General Post Office, and it was re-released in 1937 as an advertisement, with the addition of a “cheaper parcel post” message. Note: this film has been restored by the National Film and Television Archive (UK) from Lye’s original material using the Eastmancolor process.

results.title: The Illustrated Auschwitz
results.creator_credit: Kathy Drayton, Lucia Salinas Briones, Jackie Farkas and AFTRS
results.brief_description: Jackie Farkas uses the extraordinary and harrowing oral testimony of an elderly Hungarian woman as the basis for a poetic and abstract investigation into how cinema can ‘illustrate’ such profoundly horrendous experiences. The use of found footage, elusive images of beauty and horror and sequences from ‘The Wizard of Oz’ to elucidate the narrator’s memories creates an extraordinary representation of the holocaust experience, of survival, of home and memory, and of how we can comprehend the incomprehensible.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kathy Drayton, Lucia Salinas Briones, Jackie Farkas and AFTRS

results.title: Saturn's return
results.creator_credit: Helen Pankhurst, Christos Tsiolkas and Wenona Byrne
results.brief_description: ‘Saturn’s return’ is part of an SBS commissioned series called ‘Hybrid Life’, which explores the experience of second and third generation migrants. Barney and his lover Dimi set out on a road trip to visit Barney’s father who is dying of AIDS and has decided to end his life. Based on a short story by Christos Tsiolkas and directed by Wenona Byrne, the film uses the road movie journey as a means to travel through Australia’s chequered history, while the two lovers confront their families turbulent past.
